title: Client Biome
description: Minecraft client_biome files define client-side settings for biomes in resource packs. This is the new preferred location for per-biome settings that used to be in biomes_client.json.

A.title: Format Version
A.description: A version that tells minecraft what type of data format can be expected when reading this file.

B_components_ref.title: Components
B_components_ref.description: Any components that this Client Biome uses.

C.title: Ambient Sounds
C.description: Sets the ambient sounds for the biome. These sounds must be in the 'individual_named_sounds' in a 'sounds.json' file.

addition.title: Addition
addition.description: Named sound that occasionally plays at the listener position.

loop.title: Loop
loop.description: Named sound that loops while the listener position is inside the biome.

mood.title: Mood
mood.description: Named sound that rarely plays at a nearby air block position when the light level is low.

D.title: Biome Music
D.description: Affects how music plays within the biome.

volume_multiplier.title: Volume Multiplier
volume_multiplier.description: Multiplier temporarily and gradually applied to music volume when within this biome.

E.title: Fog Appearance
E.description: Set the fog settings used during rendering. Biomes without this component will have default fog settings.

fog_identifier.title: Fog Identifier
fog_identifier.description: Identifier of fog definition to use.

F.title: Sky Color
F.description: Set the sky color used during rendering. Biomes without this component will have default sky color behavior.

G.title: Water Appearance
G.description: Set the water surface color used during rendering. Biomes without this component will have default water surface color behavior.

surface_color.title: Surface Color
surface_color.description: RGB color of the water surface.

description.title: Client Biome Description
description.description: Contains non-component settings for a Client Biome.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of the Client Biome, used by other features like the '/locate biome' command. Must match the name of a Biome defined by the game or a behavior pack.
